poem:
**Fog at the Shore**

Morning, and the paper lies  
like a gull with its wing broken.  
Men in clean suits speak regret  
as if it were soap.

Old emails—leather, massages,  
a naked drift in forgiving fog—  
the beach where distance  
makes sin look small.

But fog is only vapour;  
the sea keeps names.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "LA Olympics chief says he ‘deeply regrets’ emails with Ghislaine Maxwell Casey Wasserman, the head of the Los Angeles Olympics organizing committee, said on Saturday that he “deeply regrets” emails from 2003 between him and Ghislaine Maxwell that appeared in the latest collection of government files released Friday on Jeffrey Epstein. Among the exchanges included one from Wasserman telling Maxwell “I think of you all the time. So, what do I have to do to see you in a tight leather outfit?” In an April 2003 email to Wasserman – who was married at the time – Maxwell offers to give him a massage that can “drive a man wild”. There is also an email exchange about massages and one in which Maxwell asks whether it will be foggy enough during an upcoming visit “so that you can float naked down the beach and no one can see you unless they are close up?” Wasserman responds: “or something like that.” In a statement released Saturday, Wasserman said: “I deeply regret my correspondence with Ghislaine Maxwell,” which he said occurred “long before her horrific crimes came to light”. “I never had a personal or business relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. As is well documented, I went on a humanitarian trip as part of a delegation with the Clinton Foundation in 2002 on the Epstein plane. I am terribly sorry for having any association with either of them,” he said. In 2021, Maxwell was convicted on five counts of sex trafficking and abuse". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
